thread.title: Bronco Blitz: Mountain West football power poll (Oct. 24)
thread.title_full: Bronco Blitz: Mountain West football power poll (Oct. 24)

author: ccripe@idahostatesman.com (CHADD CRIPE)
title: Bronco Blitz: Mountain West football power poll (Oct. 24)
text:
1. San Diego State: The Aztecs, who dominated Utah State 48-14 in a late game Friday night, have outscored their opponents 127-42 during four-game MW win streak. 
2. Utah State: Aggies faced difficult turnaround after emotional win over Boise State. 
3. Boise State: Broncos have committed 11 turnovers in their two losses. 
4. Colorado State: QB Nick Stevens responded well to coach Mike Bobo’s sudden vote of confidence. 
5. Air Force: Injuries are taking a toll on the Falcons, who have lost three of four. 
6. San Jose State: Star RB Tyler Ervin didn’t have any room to run against San Diego State. 
7. UNLV: Rebels blew a 14-point lead in loss at Fresno State — a collapse coach Tony Sanchez called an “abomination.” 
8. Nevada: Wolf Pack players admitted to taking Wyoming lightly. 
9. New Mexico: Lobos are 4-3 but might be underdogs in the rest of their games. 
10. Fresno State: Bulldogs’ fourth-quarter comeback vs. UNLV came out of nowhere. 
11. Wyoming: Cowboys’ freshman-laden roster got a breakthrough win against Nevada. 
12. Hawaii: The Warriors finally scored on the road — and lost to New Mexico because of a missed 22-yard field goal. Chadd Cripe: 377-6398; Twitter: @IDS_BroncoBeat
